solution_line_template: With {num_apples} apples, Steven will collect {num_apples} apples * {seeds_per_apple} seeds/apple = <<{num_apples}*{seeds_per_apple}={apple_seeds}>>{apple_seeds} seeds.
With {num_pears} pears, Steven will collect {num_pears} pears * {seeds_per_pear} seeds/pear = <<{num_pears}*{seeds_per_pear}={pear_seeds}>>{pear_pears} seeds.
With {num_grapes} grapes, Steven will collect {num_grapes} grapes * {seeds_per_grape} seeds/grape = <<{num_grapes}*{seeds_per_grape}={grape_seeds}>>{grape_seeds} seeds.
In total, Steven will collect {apple_seeds} seeds + {pear_seeds} seeds + {grape_seeds} seeds = <<{apple_seeds}+{pear_seeds}+{grape_seeds}={total_collected_seeds}>>{total_collected_seeds} seeds.
To collect {target_seeds} seeds he needs {target_seeds} seeds - {total_collected_seeds} seeds = <<{target_seeds}-{total_collected_seeds}={seeds_needed}>>{seeds_needed} more seeds.
